Description: Mould-made miniature pottery lamp-holder in the form of a temple façade flanked by flaming torches. The pointed domed top is surmounted by a suspension-lug. There is a hole broken through the rear. A few traces of post-firing colouration remain: pink at the rear, yellow within the pediment, and red on the dome.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q611.bis)
